The ACT is a standardized test widely used for college admissions in the United States. It assesses a student’s readiness for college and provides colleges with a common data point to compare all applicants. The ACT covers the following areas:

**English:**

-   **Grammar and Usage**: Testing knowledge of grammar, punctuation, and sentence structure.
-   [**Rhetorical Skills**: Assessing strategy, organization, and style in writing](https://www.act.org/content/act/en/products-and-services/the-act.html)[1](https://www.act.org/content/act/en/products-and-services/the-act.html).

**Mathematics:**

-   [**Mathematical Practices**: Covering skills typically acquired by the beginning of grade 12, including algebra, geometry, and trigonometry](https://www.act.org/content/act/en/products-and-services/the-act.html)[1](https://www.act.org/content/act/en/products-and-services/the-act.html).

**Reading:**

-   [**Reading Comprehension**: Measuring the ability to read closely, reason logically about texts using evidence, and integrate information from multiple sources](https://www.act.org/content/act/en/products-and-services/the-act.html)[1](https://www.act.org/content/act/en/products-and-services/the-act.html).

**Science:**

-   [**Scientific Reasoning**: Testing the interpretation, analysis, evaluation, reasoning, and problem-solving skills required in biology, chemistry, Earth/space sciences, and physics](https://www.act.org/content/act/en/products-and-services/the-act.html)[1](https://www.act.org/content/act/en/products-and-services/the-act.html).

**Writing (Optional):**

-   **Essay Writing**: Assessing writing skills taught in high school English classes and entry-level college composition courses. [This section is optional and does not affect the composite score](https://www.bing.com/aclick?ld=e8aMpW9hF56pFpRIWkCB8RrDVUCUyAQDuAGh4UG5t_vetxs3UC_d3CFrkFP760CMBhuFJcOaClGuHNKbM096geFhBn52_eiK7t0zLgPFrlm-xCz_zudtnLTfXqFvU5Q4VCP3FiM-8IXTmvTIncUlVTNBtsc4GhLIYt-NobHdznh0z1wU5E&&rlid=54657eada9b91d9ddda318122cb52cab)[1](https://www.act.org/content/act/en/products-and-services/the-act.html).

The **ACT is accepted by all four-year colleges and universities in the U.S.** and is also recognized by many institutions internationally. [It’s designed to measure academic achievement in these core areas and is a key component of the college application process for many students](https://www.act.org/content/act/en/products-and-services/the-act.html)[2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ACT_(test)).
